subjects.name: Business Management SL
subjects.description: Business management examines business decision‑making processes across a range of organisational types and the impact of internal and external factors. Students learn to analyse, discuss and evaluate business activities at local, national and international levels.
learningObjectives: Understand how businesses are organised and influenced by their environment
Apply business tools and techniques to real and simulated problems
Analyse human resource strategies and leadership styles
Evaluate marketing, finance and operations decisions

subjects.name: Business Management HL
subjects.description: Business management examines business decision‑making processes across a range of organisational types and the impact of internal and external factors. Students learn to analyse, discuss and evaluate business activities at local, national and international levels.
learningObjectives: Understand how businesses are organised and influenced by their environment
Apply business tools and techniques to real and simulated problems
Analyse human resource strategies and leadership styles
Evaluate marketing, finance and operations decisions

subjects.name: Economics SL
subjects.description: Economics explores how individuals and societies allocate scarce resources. The course covers microeconomics, macroeconomics, international economics and development, providing students with analytical tools to examine real‑world issues.
learningObjectives: Apply economic theories to real situations
Analyse the behaviour of consumers and producers
Evaluate economic policies and their impacts
Discuss ethical dimensions and sustainability in economics

subjects.name: Economics HL
subjects.description: Economics explores how individuals and societies allocate scarce resources. The course covers microeconomics, macroeconomics, international economics and development, providing students with analytical tools to examine real‑world issues.
learningObjectives: Apply economic theories to real situations
Analyse the behaviour of consumers and producers
Evaluate economic policies and their impacts
Discuss ethical dimensions and sustainability in economics

subjects.name: Biology SL
subjects.description: Biology explores the study of life from molecules to ecosystems. Students develop theoretical knowledge and practical skills through experimentation and fieldwork.
learningObjectives: Understand biological concepts across different levels of organisation
Analyse how genetics, evolution and ecology shape life
Develop laboratory and fieldwork skills
Evaluate the ethical implications of biological research

subjects.name: Biology HL
subjects.description: Biology explores the study of life from molecules to ecosystems. Students develop theoretical knowledge and practical skills through experimentation and fieldwork.
learningObjectives: Understand biological concepts across different levels of organisation
Analyse how genetics, evolution and ecology shape life
Develop laboratory and fieldwork skills
Evaluate the ethical implications of biological research

subjects.name: Chemistry SL
subjects.description: Chemistry combines academic study with practical skills. Students explore the structure and reactivity of matter, studying atomic and molecular behaviour, energetics, equilibrium and organic processes.
learningObjectives: Understand atomic structure and periodic trends
Explain chemical bonding and intermolecular forces
Investigate thermodynamics and reaction kinetics
Apply organic chemistry in real‑world contexts

subjects.name: Chemistry HL
subjects.description: Chemistry combines academic study with practical skills. Students explore the structure and reactivity of matter, studying atomic and molecular behaviour, energetics, equilibrium and organic processes.
learningObjectives: Understand atomic structure and periodic trends
Explain chemical bonding and intermolecular forces
Investigate thermodynamics and reaction kinetics
Apply organic chemistry in real‑world contexts

subjects.name: Physics SL
subjects.description: Physics is the most fundamental experimental science, aiming to explain the universe itself. Students explore concepts of forces, energy, particles and fields through theory and experimentation.
learningObjectives: Apply physical principles to solve problems
Conduct experiments and analyse data
Understand the interplay between theory and observation
Explore the ethical implications of physics research

subjects.name: Physics HL
subjects.description: Physics is the most fundamental experimental science, aiming to explain the universe itself. Students explore concepts of forces, energy, particles and fields through theory and experimentation.
learningObjectives: Apply physical principles to solve problems
Conduct experiments and analyse data
Understand the interplay between theory and observation
Explore the ethical implications of physics research

subjects.name: Design Technology SL
subjects.description: Design technology develops internationally minded designers through inquiry and problem solving. Students apply the design cycle to analyse needs, develop solutions and evaluate outcomes, while considering sustainability and human factors.
learningObjectives: Apply the design cycle to real design problems
Understand human factors and ergonomics
Evaluate materials and sustainability considerations
Develop prototyping and modelling skills

subjects.name: Design Technology HL
subjects.description: Design technology develops internationally minded designers through inquiry and problem solving. Students apply the design cycle to analyse needs, develop solutions and evaluate outcomes, while considering sustainability and human factors.
learningObjectives: Apply the design cycle to real design problems
Understand human factors and ergonomics
Evaluate materials and sustainability considerations
Develop prototyping and modelling skills

subjects.name: Mathematics: Analysis and Approaches SL
subjects.description: Mathematics: analysis and approaches focuses on developing important mathematical concepts in a rigorous way. It emphasises constructing mathematical arguments, exploring abstract topics and using technology appropriately.
learningObjectives: Understand and apply mathematical language and notation
Develop abstract reasoning and proof skills
Model real‑world problems using mathematical concepts
Use technology to explore and verify results

subjects.name: Mathematics: Analysis and Approaches HL
subjects.description: Mathematics: analysis and approaches focuses on developing important mathematical concepts in a rigorous way. It emphasises constructing mathematical arguments, exploring abstract topics and using technology appropriately.
learningObjectives: Understand and apply mathematical language and notation
Develop abstract reasoning and proof skills
Model real‑world problems using mathematical concepts
Use technology to explore and verify results

subjects.name: Mathematics: Applications and Interpretation SL
subjects.description: Mathematics: applications and interpretation focuses on applying mathematics to the real world and using technology to explore and model problems. It is well suited for students interested in social sciences, natural sciences, medicine, statistics, business, engineering and design.
learningObjectives: Apply mathematical models to practical situations
Interpret and communicate mathematical information
Use technology to explore and solve problems
Analyse data using statistical methods

subjects.name: Mathematics: Applications and Interpretation HL
subjects.description: Mathematics: applications and interpretation focuses on applying mathematics to the real world and using technology to explore and model problems. learningObjectives: Apply mathematical models to practical situations
